bill_title: to increase the maximum weekly benefit amount for unemployment compensation.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to increase the maximum weekly benefit amount for unemployment compensation. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 61-6-6 be amended to read as follows: 61-6-6. An individual's weekly benefit amount is computed as follows: For each fiscal year July 1, 1993 through June 30, 1994, and every fiscal year thereafter , one twenty-sixth of the wages paid for insured work in his the individual's quarter of highest earnings in his the individual's base period, but not to exceed an amount equal to fifty sixty-two percent of the average weekly wage in covered employment in South Dakota for the calendar year preceding that fiscal year. An amount so computed that is not a multiple of one dollar is lowered to the next lower multiple of one dollar. The average weekly wage in covered employment in South Dakota is computed by dividing the sum of the total wages in covered employment, as reported to the department for the preceding calendar year, by the average number of workers in covered employment, and dividing the result thus obtained by fifty-two. 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.015 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date
